optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.

detaileddescription.para: Manually set which anchors to use for positioning. Function to manually set which anchors to use for positioning by calling the register function reg:POZYX_POS_SET_ANCHOR_IDS. Notice that the anchors specified are only used if this is configured with setSelectionOfAnchors. Furthermore, the anchors specified in this functions must be available in the device list with their coordinates.

parameterdescription.para: an array with network id's of anchors to be used
the number of anchors write
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Obtain which anchors used for positioning. Function to retrieve the anchors that used for positioning by calling the register function reg:POZYX_POS_GET_ANCHOR_IDS. When in automatic anchor selection mode, the chosen anchors are listed here.

parameterdescription.para: an array with network id's of anchors manually set
the number of anchors to read.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Read the update interval continuous positioning. This function reads the configured update interval for continuous positioning from the register reg:POZYX_POS_INTERVAL.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the update interval in milliseconds. A value of 0 means that continuous positioning is disabled.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Configure the udpate interval for continuous positioning. This function configures the update interval by writing to the register reg:POZYX_POS_INTERVAL. By writing a valid value, the system will start continuous positioning which will generate a position estimate on regular intervals. This will generate a POZYX_INT_STATUS_POS interrupt when interrupts are enabled.

parameterdescription.para: update interval in milliseconds. The update interval must be larger or equal to 100ms.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the variable holding the ranging protocol used when ranging. Possible values for the ranging protocol are POZYX_RANGE_PROTOCOL_FAST and POZYX_RANGE_PROTOCOL_PRECISION.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the configured positioning filter strength. This function obtains the configured positioning filter strength by reading from the reg:POZYX_POS_FILTER register.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the variable holding the filter strength used in the built-in filter. This strength is the amount of previous samples used in positioning. Possible values for the position filter strength is between 0 and 15 samples.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the anchor selection mode. This function reads the anchor selection mode bit from the register reg:POZYX_POS_NUM_ANCHORS. This bit describes how the anchors are selected for positioning, either manually or automatically.

parameterdescription.para: reference to the anchor selection mode. Possible results are POZYX_ANCHOR_SEL_MANUAL for manual anchor selection or POZYX_ANCHOR_SEL_AUTO for automatic anchor selection.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the configured number of anchors used for positioning. This functions reads out the reg:POZYX_POS_NUM_ANCHORS register to obtain the number of anchors that are being used for positioning.

parameterdescription.para: reference to the number of anchors
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Configure how many anchors are used for positioning and how they are selected. This function configures the number of anchors used for positioning. Theoretically, a larger number of anchors leads to better positioning performance. However, in practice this is not always the case. The more anchors used for positioning, the longer the positioning process will take. Furthermore, it can be chosen which anchors are to be used: either a fixed set given by the user, or an automatic selection between all the anchors in the internal device list.

parameterdescription.para: describes how the anchors are selected. Possible values are POZYX_ANCHOR_SEL_MANUAL for manual anchor selection or POZYX_ANCHOR_SEL_AUTO for automatic anchor selection.
the number of anchors to use for positioning. Must be larger than 2 and smaller than 16.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.

simplesect.para: setPositioningAnchorIds to set the anchor IDs in manual anchor selection mode.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the operation mode of the device. This function obtains the operation mode (anchor or tag) by reading from the register reg:POZYX_OPERATION_MODE. This operation mode is independent of the hardware it is on and will have it's effect when performing discovery or auto calibration.

parameterdescription.para: The mode of operations POZYX_ANCHOR_MODE or POZYX_TAG_MODE
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Define if the device operates as a tag or an anchor. This function defines how the device should operate (as an anchor or tag) by writing to the register reg:POZYX_OPERATION_MODE. This operation mode is independent of the hardware it is on and will have it's effect when performing discovery or auto calibration. This function overrules the jumper that is present on the board.

parameterdescription.para: The mode of operations POZYX_ANCHOR_MODE or POZYX_TAG_MODE
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Get the textual system error. This function reads out the reg:POZYX_ERRORCODE register and converts the error code to a textual message.

parameterdescription.para: optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
the textual error

memberdef.argsstring: (coordinates_t *coordinates, uint8_t dimension, int32_t height, uint8_t algorithm)
memberdef.name: doPositioning

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the coordinates. This function triggers the positioning algorithm to perform positioning with the given parameters. By default it will automatically select 4 anchors from the internal device list. It will then perform ranging with these anchors and use the results to compute the coordinates. This function requires that the coordinates for the anchors are stored in the internal device list.
Please read the tutorial ready to localize to get started with positioning.

parameterdescription.para: data object to store the result
optional parameter that is used for POZYX_2_5D to give the height in mm of the tag
success.
function failed.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t remote_id, coordinates_t *coordinates, uint8_t dimension, int32_t height, uint8_t algorithm)
memberdef.name: doRemotePositioning

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t remote_id, coordinates_t *coordinates, uint8_t dimension, int32_t height=0)
memberdef.name: doRemotePositioning

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the coordinates of a remote device. Don't use with 2.5D!

This function triggers the positioning algorithm on a remote pozyx device to perform positioning with the given parameters. By default it will automatically select 4 anchors from the internal device list on the remote device. The device will perform ranging with the anchors and use the results to compute the coordinates. This function requires that the coordinates for the anchors are stored in the internal device list on the remote device. After positioning is completed, the remote device will automatically transmit the result back.

parameterdescription.para: the remote device that will do the positioning
data object to store the result
optional parameter that is used for POZYX_2_5D to give the height in mm of the tag
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Trigger ranging with a remote device. This function performs ranging with a remote device using the UWB signals.

parameterdescription.para: the target device to do ranging with
the pointer to where the resulting data will be stored
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Trigger ranging between two remote devivces. Function allowing to trigger ranging between two remote devices A and B. The ranging data is collected by device A and transmitted back to the local device.

parameterdescription.para: device A that will initiate the range request.
device B that will respond to the range request.
the pointer to where the resulting data will be stored
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieve stored ranging information. Functions to retrieve the latest ranging information (i.e., the distance, signal strength and timestamp) with respect to a remote device. This function does not trigger ranging.

parameterdescription.para: network id of the device for which range information is requested
data object to store the information
optional parameter that determines the remote device where this function is called.
